Just a long walk down Memory Lane...

Game #69 										3.2.2020.

[h1] I hate this game and the reasons for my hatred have nothing to do with the game itself [/h1]
Now, sure, I haven’t actually played enough of this game to give it a proper review… at least not here, on Steam. However, I believe that the majority of people who are about my age have played this game way before Steam was a thing.

Ahhh, Counter Strike: Source, how I loathe this game. Not because it’s bad or because it’s buggy or because the community is toxic. No, the game is actually quite fun if you get the right team and play against someone who is similarly skilled to you. 

[h1] You like video games! Me too! What's your favorite Map? Mine is Aztec1! [/h1]

The reason why I loathe this game is because, during the mid-nineties, the term “I played video games” pretty much meant “I play Counter Strike”. Luckily times have changed for the better, more or less, but back in the day, man, I could not say the term “video game” without someone mentioning Counter Strike. What, you play Super Jario,  Final Fantamashi  or Harry Pothead (Yeah, I really love Harry Potter games, please don’t judge)? Those games don’t even exist, just play CS like a normal person, is what people would tell me.

So what exactly is Counter Strike? Well, not that it needs an explanation, but it’s a first-person-shooter game where two teams (terrorists and the counter-terrorist) try to kill each other. I mean sure, as terrorists you also have to arm a bomb and as counter-terrorist you also disarm the bomb or rescue hostages but it’s mostly about killing the opposition. This game was made using the, now famous, source engine, which Valve perfected back in the day. Well, actually, this is technically just a game mod for Half Life https://store.steampowered.com/app/280/HalfLife_Source/, not that anyone remembers that nowadays. 

[h1] What made this game so popular all those years ago? [/h1]

Regardless, I’ve been trying to figure out why of all first person shooter games back in the day, this one was the most popular and was only ever dethroned by its own remake CS:GO. https://store.steampowered.com/app/730/CounterStrike_Global_Offensive/
So, in my honest opinion, there are two main reasons why this game became the legend that it is today. 

[h1] The source engine is really good [/h1]

The first is it’s engine. The source engine is absolutely fantastic for first person shooters. It’s super responsive, really accurate, a bit floaty but most importantly, even back in the day, it could run super smoothly on even the worst PCs, so pretty much, if you had a PC, you could run Counter Strike, you didn’t need a fancy GPU or a high-end processor, the source engine isn’t picky.

[h1] Yaaaaaar [/h1]

 The second reason was that, this game, was very easy to pirate. Yup, back in my elementary school days, this game was passed down on ripped CD’s like the plague. Everyone had an extra burned disk you could borrow and everyone was willing to share. Now, I don’t want to bad mouth Russians, but they are quite famous for pirating all their software (my country pirates everything too while I’m the only idiot who actually buys things legit) so it’s no wonder that the majority of its player base still are from Russia. 

[h1] Did I mention that I really like Russia and its culture??? ... please don't kill me... [/h1]

Ok, now enough about the game, it’s history and my racism, I guess I should state whether or not there is a point in owning this today in 2020 and beyond. So are there people still playing this? Yes! Is it hard to find a game? No. Is it still fun? Yes. Should you buy this? Ehhh…. Not really.

Let’s be real here, if you are going to play Counter Strike today, you sure aren’t going to choose this old version over CS:GO, even if you are a veteran. The only real reason why you would buy this game over it’s remake is because it’s more or less a mandatory game to get “Garry’s Mod”  https://store.steampowered.com/app/4000/Garrys_Mod/ to launch most of it’s games (at least that’s the reason why I bought this in the first place.

[h1] Even if I didn't hate it, there just isn't a good enough reason to play this game anymore [/h1]

Overall, this is a fun game that I hate because when I was growing up nobody cared about any other game except for this. Because of that reason alone, I will forever hate this game. 
Other than that, unless you need this for Garry’s Mod, there isn’t much reason to buy this over CS:GO.

Next game: Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy
https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198075061111/recommended/731490/

[h3]If you liked my review, feel free to follow my curator group. I’m trying to review every single game in my library. Seeing and interacting with fine folks, like you, keeps my motivation up. 
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/RevAMG [/h3]

самая уебанская стрельба блять!!! Пошел нах сурс. С каждой сука версией стрельба становится дебильной блять, пули сквозь игрока летят и не дамажит. В пизду её, не играйте. Ещё и куча парашных серверов, где бегают випки с дебильными скинами, ещё и АДМИНЫ СУКА ПИДОРЫ, которые засрут свои же сервера всяким шлаком, где есть команда медик, вип тест всратый и прочее говно этой говнянной игры. Я уже тут без матов не могу уж простите меня, неженки. КРЧ ИГРА ДЕРЬМИЩЕ, С КОНЧЕННОЙ СТРЕЛЬБОЙ КАК В 1.6( как в кс го стрельба устроена я не знаю). НАдеюсь вы миллион раз подумаете прежде чем покупать этот кусок говна.

CS’nin önceki sürümleriyle karşılaştırılamayacak artılara sahip olsa bile, onlara oranla kısıtlı harita sayısı ile küçük de bir eksiye sahip Source. CS ve CS:CZ’de kaç tane olduğunu hatırlamıyor olsam da, ve zaten çoğunun yoğunluklu olarak oynanmadığı bilinse de, Valve’dekiler Source’de önceki seriden oyuncuların en çok sevdikleri haritaları yeni nesil oyunlarında koruma yoluna gitmişler. dust, dust2, office, havana, aztec oyundaki görünen 8 haritadan bazıları. Benim en beğendiğim bölüm olan italy ise bütün ihtişamıyla oyundaki yerini alıyor(iyi ki CS’yi sevmiyormuşum ha!). Keza silahlarda da önceki oyunlardakilerin üzerine çok fazla bir eklemede veya eksiltmede bulunulmamış. Ama detayları artmış ve çok daha gerçekçi bir görünüm kazanmışlar. Tetiğe dokunduğunuz an elinizde silah olduğu hissini tamamen fark ediyorsunuz, bunun yanı sıra mermilerden ve boş kovanlardan çıkan seslerdeki doygun tınılar da kendini hemen belli ediyor. Modellerin aynısı üzerine bayağı bir çalışıldığı belli. En basit örnek olarak zoom’lu silahların dürbün kısmında hedefteki yerin görünebiliyor olmasından bahsedebilirim. Sürekli etkileşim halinde olması ve parlaklığı da tek kelimelik.

The inbetweeny Counter-Strike. Not the original, and not Global Offensive. There's not really a whole lot here other than a bit fancier graphics compared to the original, and the fact that it's running on a newer engine. But there's obviously no updates coming out for it any more. What it is now is what it'll be forever more. The community isn't as large as the one around the original Counter-Strike, since a lot of people stuck to that one and didn't want to transition over to this one, and anyone wanting to get into CS nowadays, goes for CSGO instead.

If anything, I'd recommend either the original CS, if you're looking to play the old-school stuff, or CSGO if you just want to play the quintessential PC shooter. However, if the community of CSGO doesn't work out for you, and the original CS it a bit too old for you, then this might just scratch that itch, but other than that, at this point, this game is little more than a novelty. Maybe buy it on sale or get it as part of the CS pack or the Valve pack and see what the deal is, but other than that, you can skip past this.
